score.explanation: The Wi-Fi network is generally performing well, but some random dropouts suggest issues with stability.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload improved, ping improved, networks increased.

latest_report.diagnosis: Your Wi-Fi network experiences random dropouts, likely due to congestion on the 2.4GHz band. Optimizing channel settings may enhance stability.

performance.interpretation: The current download speed is good for streaming and gaming, but the upload speed is on the lower side for work tasks. Ping is also satisfactory.

problems: 2.4GHz band congestion due to multiple overlapping networks.
Low upload speed may affect performance for gaming and video calls.
Random dropouts experienced, potentially linked to channel interference.
fixes: Change the 2.4GHz channel to 1 to reduce interference from neighboring networks.
Switch the 5GHz channel to 149 to use a less congested band.
Consider relocating the router closer to the center of the home to improve coverage.
Enable QoS settings to prioritize bandwidth for gaming devices.
Reduce interference by positioning the router away from windows and walls.
